span.p: This page is your one-stop-shop for all information regarding COVID-19 and RLAS116. Please check this page often for up-to-date information for you and your family.

h1.aria-label: APRIL 17, 2020: GOVERNOR PRITZKER'S ANNOUNCEMENT RE: SCHOOL CLOSURES
h1.span: APRIL 17, 2020: GOVERNOR PRITZKER'S ANNOUNCEMENT RE: SCHOOL CLOSURES

p.span: This afternoon, Governor Pritzker announced that all in-person classroom instruction will be suspended for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. While we have been planning for this decision, we still acknowledge that this is still very difficult to digest.

RLAS-116 is very fortunate in that we are now able to provide E-Learning instruction to all students in grades PK-12. While this is not ideal, we will continue to ensure that students have the best possible learning experiences for the remainder of this school year. We ask you, as parents and guardians, to continue to foster the importance of education to your children during these trying times. We will partner with you by providing you with the educational resources you need for your family.

Allow me to reemphasize that we know that our students, staff and families are doing their very best during this school closure time period and that is all we can ask for. Please continue to stay engaged during this process. There will certainly be questions as we progress through this E-Learning structure. Please continue to work with your child’s teachers and school administration. We are here to help you.
If you have any questions related to your child’s instruction, please contact their teacher(s) or school administration.

h1.aria-label: MARCH 31, 2020 - DISTRICT UPDATE RE: GOVERNOR PRITZKER ANNOUNCEMENT
h1.span: MARCH 31, 2020 - DISTRICT UPDATE RE: GOVERNOR PRITZKER ANNOUNCEMENT
MARCH 31, 2020 - DISTRICT UPDATE RE: GOVERNOR PRITZKER ANNOUNCMENT

div.p:
Dear RLAS-116 Families:
Governor Pritzker announced on Tuesday, March 31 that he plans to sign a new Executive Order that will extend the Stay-at-Home order through April 30, 2020. While this was anticipated, we acknowledge that this puts additional hardship on many across our District and community. This is unchartered territory for everyone. Please take your time and do your best in these trying times.
Our District has been working proactively to establish remote learning plans in the event the closure was to be extended. Know that we are ready!
Middle & High School
Our middle and high school students will continue with their established E-Learning plans throughout the closure. Teachers and administration are available to both students and parents. Please contact them via email if you need assistance.
Elementary (Grades PK-5)
This week, students should be completing their second week of work from the packets that were distributed on March 13. Weeks 3 and 4 work packets are being mailed to families this week. Students should begin their work on these packets starting Monday, April 6. If for some reason you do not receive your child’s packet by Saturday you may access them on the E-Learning tab of our website at www.rlas-116.org or contact your school principal via email.
District staff are working diligently to gather all available technology devices from across our schools so that we are able to deploy them to our elementary students to use at home. A deployment plan is being finalized with tentative plans to distribute the devices to our elementary students the week of April 6. Deployment details will be communicated to families later this week.
Our elementary teachers began training this week in preparation for E-Learning. They will begin to build their “online” classrooms next week. We plan to begin official E-Learning at the elementary level on Monday, April 20.
Please remember, we know this is a challenging time and implementing an E-Learning structure for your elementary-aged child at home may prove challenging. We will be here every step of the way to support our parents and students.
Grab-n-Go Meal Distribution
We will continue to serve free Grab-n-Go breakfast/lunch meals to all RLAS-116 children Monday-Friday, 8:00am-11:00am, at Round Lake High School, Round Lake Middle School, Beach Elementary, Ellis Elementary, Murphy Elementary and Village Elementary throughout the entire closure. This distribution is easy. You drive up, let the servers know how many meals are needed, and then grab them off the serving table.
Thank you for your support during these very challenging times. Let’s continue to work together to provide the best possible educational experiences for our children.
Take care,
Donn Mendoza, Superintendent
______________________________________________________________________________
Estimadas familias RLAS-116:
El Gobernador Pritzker anunció el martes 31 de marzo que piensa firmar una nueva Orden Ejecutiva para extender la orden de Quedarse en Casa hasta el 30 de abril del 2020. Aunque esta medida era de esperarse, reconocemos que pone en una situación difícil a muchos en nuestro Distrito y comunidad. Es territorio desconocido para todos. Por favor, tómese su tiempo y de lo mejor de sí mismo en estos tiempos difíciles.
Nuestro Distrito ha estado trabajando de manera proactiva para establecer planes de aprendizaje virtuales en caso se extendiera el cierre. ¡Estamos preparados!
Escuela secundaria y superior
Nuestros estudiantes de escuela secundaria y superior continuarán con sus planes de aprendizaje virtual, E-learning, previamente establecidos hasta el cierre. Los profesores y personal de administración estarán disponibles para los estudiantes y padres. Por favor, contáctelos por correo electrónico si necesita asistencia.
Primaria (Grados PK-5)
Esta semana, los estudiantes deberían completar su segunda semana de trabajo de los paquetes que se entregaron el 13 de marzo. Las semanas 3 y 4 de los paquetes de trabajo se enviarán por correo a todas las familias, esta semana. Los estudiantes deberían empezar a trabajar en estos paquetes el lunes 6 de abril. Si por cualquier motivo, no recibe el paquete de su hijo hasta el sábado, puede acceder a ellos mediante la opción de E-Learning en nuestro sitio web www.rlas-116.org o contáctese con el director de su escuela por correo electrónico.
El personal del distrito está trabajando de manera exhaustiva para recopilar todos los dispositivos electrónicos disponibles de todas nuestras escuelas para poder entregarlos a nuestros estudiantes de primaria para que los utilicen en sus hogares. Se está completando un plan de entrega con planes tentativos de distribución de dispositivos a nuestros estudiantes de primaria la semana del 6 de abril.
Esta semana se informarán los detalles de entrega a las familias.
Esta semana, nuestros profesores de elementan empezaron la capacitación en preparación para la enseñanza virtual, E-Learning. Ellos empezarán a preparar sus aulas “virtuales” la próxima semana. El lunes 20 de abril, pensamos dar inicio oficial a la enseñanza virtual, E-Learning en el nivel primaria.
Por favor recuerde, nosotros sabemos que es un momento difícil e implementar la estructura de aprendizaje virtual, E-Learning en sus hogares para sus hijos de la escuela primaria, puede ser un reto. Estamos aquí para ayudarlo en cada paso y brindarle nuestro apoyo a los padres y estudiantes.
Distribución de alimentos Grab-n-Go
Continuaremos sirviendo desayuno/almuerzo Gran-n-Go gratis a todos los niños de RLAS-116 de lunes a viernes, de 8:00 a. m. a 11:00 a. m., en Round Lake High School, Round Lake Middle School, Beach Elementary, Ellis Elementary, Murphy Elementary y Village Elementary durante todo el cierre. La distribución será sencilla. Usted viene con su auto, les hace saber a los ayudantes cuántas comidas necesita, y luego se las lleva de la mesa de servicio.
Gracias por su apoyo durante estos momentos tan difíciles. Continuemos trabajando juntos para brindar la mejor experiencia educativa posible para sus hijos.
¡Cuídense!
Donn Mendoza, Superintendente

p.strong: Round Lake Area Schools CUSD#116 Current Students

div.p:
Monday, March 16 - Thursday, March 19
8:00am-10:00am
This program is provided by Illinois State Board of Education Child Nutrition Program.
Grab-N-Go Bag Breakfast & Lunch

ul.li:
1 breakfast and 1 lunch meal per current RLAS-116 student will be available for pickup at the following Main Entrance Locations:
Round Lake High School/Magee Middle School go to Round Lake High School
Round Lake Middle/Indian Hill go to Round Lake Middle School
Beach Elementary School
Ellis Elementary School
Murphy Elementary School
Village Elementary School/Early Education Center (EEC) go to Village Elementary School
Pleviak may go to any location listed above

div.p: You may pick up a breakfast and lunch meal for all of your currently enrolled children at any of the locations listed above.

p.strong: ESTUDIANTES ACTUALES DEL DISTRITO ESCOLAR DE ROUND LAKE #116
SERVICIO DE DESAYUNO Y ALMUERZO PARA TOMAR Y LLEVAR

hr.p: 8:00am-10:00 a.m. del lunes 16 de marzo hasta el jueves el 19 de marzo, 2020
Este programa es proporcionado por el Programa de Nutrición Infantil de la Junta de Educación del Estado de Illinois.
Bolsa de desayuno y almuerzo para Tomar y Llevar

ul.li:
Cada estudiante actual del Distrito Escolar de Round Lake 116 podrá recoger 1 desayuno y 1 almuerzo en la ENTRADA PRINCIPAL de las siguientes escuelas:
Preparatoria de Round Lake-para los estudiantes de la preparatoria y la escuela secundaria Magee
Escuela Secundaria de Round Lake para los estudiantes de la Secundaria de Round Lake y de la escuela primaria Indian Hill
Escuela Primaria Beach
Escuela Primaria Ellis
Escuela Primaria Murphy
Escuela Primaria Village -para estudiantes de Village y del Preescolar (EEC)
Los estudiantes de Pleviak pueden ir a cualquiera de estas escuelas.

hr.p: Puede recoger desayunos y almuerzos para todos los niños de su hogar que estén actualmente inscritos, en cualquiera de estas escuelas.

h1.aria-label: MARCH 13, 2020 - DETAILS FOR MIDDLE SCHOOL & HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS
h1.span: MARCH 13, 2020 - DETAILS FOR MIDDLE SCHOOL & HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS
MARCH 13, 2020 - DETAILS FOR MIDDLE SCHOOL & HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS

div.p: Good evening.

During the school closure days of Monday, March 16 through Thursday, March 19, your middle or high school student is expected to participate in their classes via an E-Learning Model. This is in an effort to offer an uninterrupted educational experience for your child.

Teachers will be providing students with learning activities on a daily basis through their Canvas or Google Classroom. Students are expected to sign on daily and complete activities and work as assigned. Teachers will make themselves available digitally and will post their available hours on their classroom pages.

If a family does not have home internet service, they may contact Comcast as they may be eligible for Comcast Internet Essentials. Comcast is waiving program fees for the next 60 days. Information is available at https://internetessentials.com/. Families having difficulty with accessing home internet services should contact Kurt Rohlwing, Director of Secondary Education at krohlwing@rlas-116.org.
In addition, any student who requires technical support may contact our Student Tech Hotline at 847-270-9039.
Thank you,

Kurt Rohlwing
Director of Secondary Education

hr.p: Durante los días en que las escuelas estén cerradas, del lunes 16 de marzo al jueves 19 de marzo, se espera que su hijo de la escuela secundaria o media participe en sus clases a través de un modelo de aprendizaje electrónico. Esto es en un esfuerzo por ofrecer una experiencia educativa ininterrumpida para su hijo.

Los maestros proporcionarán a los estudiantes actividades de aprendizaje diariamente a través de su Canvas o Google Classroom. Se espera que los estudiantes se inscriban en las actividades diarias y que completen las tareas asignadas. Los maestros se pondrán a disposición digitalmente, y publicarán sus horarios disponibles en las páginas de sus clases.

Si una familia no tiene servicio de Internet en el hogar, pueden ponerse en contacto con Comcast ya que pueden ser elegibles para Comcast Internet Essentials. Comcast no cobrará las tarifas del programa durante los próximos 60 días. Hay información disponible en https://internetessentials.com/. Las familias que tengan dificultades para acceder a los servicios de Internet en el hogar deben ponerse en contacto con Kurt Rohlwing, Director de Educación Secundaria en krohlwing@rlas-116.org.
Además, cualquier estudiante que requiera soporte técnico puede comunicarse con nuestra línea de ayuda técnica para estudiantes al 847-270-9039.

Kurt Rohlwing
Director de educación secundaria

div.p: Dear RLAS-116 Families:

Due to the rapidly evolving COVID-19 Pandemic, RLAS-116 has made a decision to close the District effective Monday, March 16, 2020 through at least Friday, March 27, 2020. We will continue to assess the progress of this situation and will communicate any changes as additional information becomes available.
Please note: We have NOT had a confirmed case of COVID-19 in our District and/or community.
Students are being prepared for alternative learning options today, including:
Elementary students (Grades PK-5) – Work packets with instructions are being backpacked home with students today.
Middle & High School students – E-Learning instructions are being shared with students today.
The District is developing a plan for how breakfast and lunch distribution may continue throughout the closure. We will share these details as soon as possible.
Know that we are monitoring this situation closely and will communicate regularly. Please continue to monitor your email and/or the District website at www.rlas-116.org for additional updates.
Thank you,
Heather Bennett
Director of Engagement & Community Relations
Hello,
As news of COVID-19 continues to be at the top of the headlines and a concern of many, we wanted to share an update with you.

Please be aware that the District has a Pandemic Preparedness Team (required by Board policy) and it has been working over the last few weeks to further develop established procedures related to issues such as COVID-19. We have been in regular contact with the Lake County Health Department to ensure that our work in this area aligns with best practice measures. The District continues to follow CDC recommended cleaning procedures across the District and is monitoring absence rates due to flu-like symptoms by school.
As a reminder, to help prevent the spread of illness, staff and students are strongly encouraged to stay home from work/school when experiencing any of the following symptoms:

Has fever of 100.4 degrees (oral) or higherHas cramps and/or vomiting
Has sore throat with fever
Has persistent cough (dry or productive)
Has diarrhea (three or more episodes in 24 hours)
Has symptoms that prevent him/her from participating in school/work, such as:
Excessive tiredness or lack of appetite
Headaches, body aches, earaches
Severe sore throat
In addition, as stories of possible exposures continue to develop across the country, it is very important that we communicate. If you have any concerns or have heard from students and/or parents regarding potential exposures, please notify your school administration. They will then immediately notify the Pandemic Preparedness Team. All reports will be thoroughly investigated and if there is a need to communicate results of the investigation, we will do so.
If you have any questions about this information, please contact your school administrator.
Thank you,

Heather Bennett
Director of Engagement & Community Relations

p.br: Como las noticias de COVID-19 continúan encabezando los titulares y preocupando a muchos, quisimos compartir una actualización.

hr.p: Tenga en cuenta que el Distrito tiene un Equipo de preparación para pandemias (requerido por la política de la Junta) y ha estado trabajando durante las últimas semanas para desarrollar aún más los procedimientos establecidos relacionados con temas como COVID-19. Hemos estado en contacto regular con el Departamento de Salud del Condado de Lake para asegurarnos de que nuestro trabajo en esta área se alinee con las mejores prácticas. El Distrito continúa siguiendo los procedimientos de limpieza recomendados por los CDC en todo el Distrito y está monitoreando las tasas de ausencia por síntomas similares a la gripe por escuela.

Como recordatorio, para ayudar a prevenir la propagación de enfermedades, se recomienda encarecidamente al personal y a los estudiantes que se queden en casa sin asistir al trabajo/escuela cuando experimenten cualquiera de los siguientes síntomas:

Tiene fiebre de 100.4 grados (oral) o más altaTiene calambres o vómitos
Tiene dolor de garganta con fiebre
Tiene tos persistente (seca o productiva)
Tiene diarrea (tres o más episodios en 24 horas)
Tiene síntomas que le impiden participar en la escuela, como:
Cansancio excesivo o falta de apetito
Dolores de cabeza, dolores corporales, dolores de oído
Dolor de garganta fuerte
Además, a medida que continúan desarrollándose historias de posibles exposiciones en todo el país, es muy importante que nos comuniquemos. Si tiene alguna inquietud o ha tenido noticias de estudiantes o padres sobre posibles exposiciones, notifique a la administración de su escuela. Luego, ellos notificarán inmediatamente al Equipo de Preparación para Pandemias. Todos los informes se investigarán a fondo y, si es necesario, se comunicarán los resultados de la investigación.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre esta información, comuníquese con el administrador de su escuela.

Heather Bennett
Directora de Participación y Relaciones Comunitarias
